channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Grouped Pointwise Convolutions Reduce Parameters in Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: In Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (DCNNs), the parameter count in pointwise convolutions quickly grows due to the multiplication of the filters and input channels from the preceding layer.

item.title: Color-aware two-branch DCNN for efficient plant disease classification
item.description: Deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) have been successfully applied to plant disease detection.

item.title: On the Robustness of Dialogue History Representation in Conversational Question Answering: A Comprehensive Study and a New Prompt-based Method
item.description: We find that high benchmark scores do not necessarily translate to strong robustness, and that various methods can perform extremely differently under different settings.

item.title: GERNERMED++: Transfer Learning in German Medical NLP
item.description: We present a statistical model for German medical natural language processing trained for named entity recognition (NER) as an open, publicly available model.

item.title: Technical Report for CVPR 2022 LOVEU AQTC Challenge
item.description: This technical report presents the 2nd winning model for AQTC, a task newly introduced in CVPR 2022 LOng-form VidEo Understanding (LOVEU) challenges.

item.title: The Lighter The Better: Rethinking Transformers in Medical Image Segmentation Through Adaptive Pruning
item.description: To our best knowledge, this is the first work on transformer pruning for medical image analysis tasks.

item.title: Summarizing Videos using Concentrated Attention and Considering the Uniqueness and Diversity of the Video Frames
item.description: Instead of simply modeling the frames' dependencies based on global attention, our method integrates a concentrated attention mechanism that is able to focus on non-overlapping blocks in the main diagonal of the attention matrix, and to enrich the existing information by extracting and exploiting knowledge about the uniqueness and diversity of the associated frames of the video.

item.title: LViT: Language meets Vision Transformer in Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In our model, medical text annotation is introduced to compensate for the quality deficiency in image data.

item.title: SRCN3D: Sparse R-CNN 3D Surround-View Camera Object Detection and Tracking for Autonomous Driving
item.description: This paper proposes Sparse R-CNN 3D (SRCN3D), a novel two-stage fully-convolutional mapping pipeline for surround-view camera detection and tracking.

item.title: Visual Foresight With a Local Dynamics Model
item.description: By combining the LDM with model-free policy learning, we can learn policies which can solve complex manipulation tasks using one-step lookahead planning.

item.title: Procrustes Analysis with Deformations: A Closed-Form Solution by Eigenvalue Decomposition
item.description: We show that this property fortunately holds true for most common transformation models, including the affine and TPS models.

item.title: An extensible Benchmarking Graph-Mesh dataset for studying Steady-State Incompressible Navier-Stokes Equations
item.description: Recent progress in \emph{Geometric Deep Learning} (GDL) has shown its potential to provide powerful data-driven models.

item.title: Distilling Model Failures as Directions in Latent Space
item.description: Existing methods for isolating hard subpopulations and spurious correlations in datasets often require human intervention.

item.title: vMFNet: Compositionality Meets Domain-generalised Segmentation
item.description: Moreover, with a reconstruction module, unlabeled data can also be used to learn the vMF kernels and likelihoods by recombining them to reconstruct the input image.

item.title: Multi-scale Physical Representations for Approximating PDE Solutions with Graph Neural Operators
item.description: In this work, we study three multi-resolution schema with integral kernel operators that can be approximated with \emph{Message Passing Graph Neural Networks} (MPGNNs).

item.title: Placenta Segmentation in Ultrasound Imaging: Addressing Sources of Uncertainty and Limited Field-of-View
item.description: Automatic segmentation of the placenta in fetal ultrasound (US) is challenging due to the (i) high diversity of placenta appearance, (ii) the restricted quality in US resulting in highly variable reference annotations, and (iii) the limited field-of-view of US prohibiting whole placenta assessment at late gestation.

item.title: Conditionally Elicitable Dynamic Risk Measures for Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We propose a novel framework to solve risk-sensitive reinforcement learning (RL) problems where the agent optimises time-consistent dynamic spectral risk measures.

item.title: Towards a Data-Driven Requirements Engineering Approach: Automatic Analysis of User Reviews
item.description: We are concerned by Data Driven Requirements Engineering, and in particular the consideration of user's reviews.

item.title: Score Matching for Truncated Density Estimation on a Manifold
item.description: When observations are truncated, we are limited to an incomplete picture of our dataset.

item.title: Finstreder: Simple and fast Spoken Language Understanding with Finite State Transducers using modern Speech-to-Text models
item.description: In Spoken Language Understanding (SLU) the task is to extract important information from audio commands, like the intent of what a user wants the system to do and special entities like locations or numbers.

item.title: TE2Rules: Extracting Rule Lists from Tree Ensembles
item.description: Tree Ensemble (TE) models (e. g. Gradient Boosted Trees and Random Forests) often provide higher prediction performance compared to single decision trees.

item.title: CONVIQT: Contrastive Video Quality Estimator
item.description: Perceptual video quality assessment (VQA) is an integral component of many streaming and video sharing platforms.

item.title: C2FTrans: Coarse-to-Fine Transformers for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: However, most recent transformer-based methods for medical image segmentation directly apply vanilla transformers as an auxiliary module in CNN-based methods, resulting in severe detail loss due to the rigid patch partitioning scheme in transformers.

item.title: DDKtor: Automatic Diadochokinetic Speech Analysis
item.description: These segmentations predicted by the models are used to obtain measures of speech rate and sound duration.

item.title: Using Twitter Data to Understand Public Perceptions of Approved versus Off-label Use for COVID-19-related Medications
item.description: Time-trend analysis revealed that Hydroxychloroquine and Ivermectin received much more discussion than Molnupiravir and Remdesivir, particularly during COVID-19 surges.

item.title: Correctly Modeling TX and RX Chain in (Distributed) Massive MIMO -- New Fundamental Insights on Coherency
item.description: In particular, the Local Oscillator (LO) effect should be modeled as $+\phi$ in the transmitter chain and $-\phi$ in the receiver chain, i. e., different signs.

item.title: Robust Online Voltage Control with an Unknown Grid Topology
item.description: Voltage control generally requires accurate information about the grid's topology in order to guarantee network stability.

item.title: Optimization-Induced Graph Implicit Nonlinear Diffusion
item.description: Moreover, we show that the optimization-induced variants of our models can boost the performance and improve training stability and efficiency as well.

item.title: Adversarial Ensemble Training by Jointly Learning Label Dependencies and Member Models
item.description: Training an ensemble of different sub-models has empirically proven to be an effective strategy to improve deep neural networks' adversarial robustness.

item.title: Smart Data Collection System for Brownfield CNC Milling Machines: A New Benchmark Dataset for Data-Driven Machine Monitoring
item.description: To enhance the scalability of machine learning in real-world applications, this paper presents a benchmark dataset for process monitoring of brownfield milling machines based on acceleration data.

item.title: CC-Riddle: A Question Answering Dataset of Chinese Character Riddles
item.description: Chinese character riddle is a challenging riddle game which takes a single character as the solution.

item.title: NERDA-Con: Extending NER models for Continual Learning -- Integrating Distinct Tasks and Updating Distribution Shifts
item.description: With increasing applications in areas such as biomedical information extraction pipelines and social media analytics, Named Entity Recognition (NER) has become an indispensable tool for knowledge extraction.

item.title: How to Steer Your Adversary: Targeted and Efficient Model Stealing Defenses with Gradient Redirection
item.description: To meet these challenges, we present a new approach to model stealing defenses called gradient redirection.

item.title: Multi-Prior Learning via Neural Architecture Search for Blind Face Restoration
item.description: To this end, we propose a Face Restoration Searching Network (FRSNet) to adaptively search the suitable feature extraction architecture within our specified search space, which can directly contribute to the restoration quality.

item.title: Online Anomaly Detection Based On Reservoir Sampling and LOF for IoT devices
item.description: The growing number of IoT devices and their use to monitor the operation of machines and equipment increases interest in anomaly detection algorithms running on devices.

item.title: SHELS: Exclusive Feature Sets for Novelty Detection and Continual Learning Without Class Boundaries
item.description: Inspired by natural learners, we introduce a Sparse High-level-Exclusive, Low-level-Shared feature representation (SHELS) that simultaneously encourages learning exclusive sets of high-level features and essential, shared low-level features.

item.title: Memory Safe Computations with XLA Compiler
item.description: We believe that further focus on removing memory constraints at a compiler level will widen the range of machine learning methods that can be developed in the future.

item.title: TTS-CGAN: A Transformer Time-Series Conditional GAN for Biosignal Data Augmentation
item.description: For time-series data, the suite of data augmentation strategies we can use to expand the size of the dataset is limited by the need to maintain the basic properties of the signal.

item.title: PyEPO: A PyTorch-based End-to-End Predict-then-Optimize Library for Linear and Integer Programming
item.description: It provides two base algorithms: the first is based on the convex surrogate loss function from the seminal work of Elmachtoub & Grigas (2021), and the second is based on the differentiable black-box solver approach of Vlastelica et al. (2019).

item.title: Learning Symmetric Rules with SATNet
item.description: SATNet is a differentiable constraint solver with a custom backpropagation algorithm, which can be used as a layer in a deep-learning system.

item.title: Pedestrian 3D Bounding Box Prediction
item.description: Safety is still the main issue of autonomous driving, and in order to be globally deployed, they need to predict pedestrians' motions sufficiently in advance.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Challenges in Converting Deep Learning Models
item.description: Usually DL models are developed and trained using DL frameworks that have their own internal mechanisms/formats to represent and train DL models, and usually those formats cannot be recognized by other frameworks.

item.title: SMT-based Weighted Model Integration with Structure Awareness
item.description: Weighted Model Integration (WMI) is a popular formalism aimed at unifying approaches for probabilistic inference in hybrid domains, involving logical and algebraic constraints.

item.title: Learning the Evolutionary and Multi-scale Graph Structure for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting
item.description: To equip the graph neural network with a flexible and practical graph structure, in this paper, we investigate how to model the evolutionary and multi-scale interactions of time series.

item.title: Learning Gait Representation from Massive Unlabelled Walking Videos: A Benchmark
item.description: As far as we know, GaitLU-1M is the first large-scale unlabelled gait dataset, and GaitSSB is the first method that achieves remarkable unsupervised results on the aforementioned benchmarks.

item.title: Algorithms for audio inpainting based on probabilistic nonnegative matrix factorization
item.description: First, we treat the missing samples as latent variables, and derive two expectation-maximization algorithms for estimating the parameters of the model, depending on whether we formulate the problem in the time- or time-frequency domain.

item.title: Simplifying Dataflow Dialogue Design
item.description: This paper argues that this perception is wrong: 1) Suggestions for a simplified format for the annotation of the dataset are presented, 2) An implementation of the DF execution engine is released\footnote{https://github. com/telepathylabsai/OpenDF}, which can serve as a sandbox allowing researchers to easily implement, and experiment with, new DF dialogue designs.

item.title: BertNet: Harvesting Knowledge Graphs from Pretrained Language Models
item.description: As a result, we derive from diverse LMs a family of new KGs (e. g., BertNet and RoBERTaNet) that contain a richer set of commonsense relations, including complex ones (e. g., "A is capable of but not good at B"), than the human-annotated KGs (e. g., ConceptNet).

item.title: Sublinear-Time Clustering Oracle for Signed Graphs
item.description: We provide a local clustering oracle for signed graphs with such a clear community structure, that can answer membership queries, i. e., "Given a vertex $v$, which community does $v$ belong to?

item.title: Robustifying Vision Transformer without Retraining from Scratch by Test-Time Class-Conditional Feature Alignment
item.description: Vision Transformer (ViT) is becoming more popular in image processing.
